children.name: value

parameters.name: options `String|Number`
parameters.description: The new value to be set.

children.description: Change the value of the QR code.

children.name: svg
Example - get the SVG representation of the qrcode

children.description: Returns the [SVG](http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/) representation of the qrcode. The returned string is a self-contained SVG document that can be used as is or converted to other formats using tools like [Inkscape](http://inkscape.org/) and[ImageMagick](http://www.imagemagick.org/). Both programs provide command-line interface suitable for server-side processing.> This method is obsoleted by [exportSVG](#methods-exportSVG), but will remain fully functional.

children.name: setOptions

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: An object with the new options. All [configuration](qrcode#configuration) options can be set.

children.description: Sets new options to the QRCode and redraws it.

children.name: resize

parameters.name: force `Boolean` *optional*
parameters.description: Defines whether the widget should proceed with resizing even if the element dimensions have not changed.

children.description: Adjusts the widget layout to match the size of the container.

children.name: redraw
children.description: Redraws the QR code using the current value and options.

children.name: imageDataURL
Example - show a snapshot of the QRCode

children.description: Returns a PNG image of the qrcode encoded as a [Data URL](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).> This method is deprecated and replaced by [exportImage](#methods-exportImage).

children.name: exportSVG
Example - Exporting a QRCode to an SVG document

parameters.name: options.raw `Boolean` *(default: false)*
parameters.description: Resolves the promise with the raw SVG document without the Data URI prefix.

children.description: Exports the QRCode as an SVG document.The result can be saved using [kendo.saveAs](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-saveAs).The export operation is asynchronous and returns a [promise](http://api.jquery.com/Types/#Promise).The promise will be resolved with a SVG document encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).

children.name: exportPDF
Example - Exporting a QRCode to a PDF file

parameters.name: options `kendo.drawing.PDFOptions` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Parameters for the exported PDF file.

children.description: Exports the QRCode as a PDF file.The result can be saved using [kendo.saveAs](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-saveAs).The export operation is asynchronous and returns a [promise](http://api.jquery.com/Types/#Promise).The promise will be resolved with a PDF file encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).

children.name: exportImage
Example - Exporting a QRCode to an image

parameters.name: options.height `String`
parameters.description: The height of the exported image. Defaults to the QRCode height.

parameters.name: options.width `String`
parameters.description: The width of the exported image. Defaults to the QRCode width.

children.description: Exports the QRCode as an image.The result can be saved using [kendo.saveAs](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-saveAs).The export operation is asynchronous and returns a [promise](http://api.jquery.com/Types/#Promise).The promise will be resolved with a PNG image encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the QRCode for safe removal from the DOM.Removes data entries in order to avoid memory leaks.

children.name: value
children.description: The value of the QRCode.

children.name: size
children.description: Specifies the size of a QR code in pixels (i.e. "200px"). Numeric values are treated as pixels.If no size is specified, it will be determined from the element width and height.In case the element has width or height of zero, a default value of 200 pixels will be used.

children.name: renderAs
children.description: Sets the preferred rendering engine.If it is not supported by the browser, the QRCode will switch to the first available mode.The supported values are:* "canvas" - renders the widget as a Canvas element, if available.* "svg" - renders the widget as inline SVG document, if available* "vml" - renders the widget as VML, if available

children.name: padding
children.description: Sets the minimum distance in pixels that should be left between the border and the QR modules.

children.name: errorCorrection
children.description: The error correction level used to encode the value.The possible values are:* "L" - approximately 7% of the codewords can be restored.* "M" - approximately 15% of the codewords can be restored.* "Q" - approximately 25% of the codewords can be restored.* "H" - approximately 30% of the codewords can be restored.

children.name: encoding
children.description: The encoding mode used to encode the value.The possible values are:* "ISO\_8859\_1" - supports all characters from the [ISO/IEC 8859-1](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO/IEC_8859-1) character set.* "UTF_8" - supports all [Unicode](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unicode_characters) characters.> *Important:* The UTF-8 encoding is not included in the specifications and is not supported by all readers.

children.name: color
children.description: The color of the QR code. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: border.width
children.description: The width of the border in pixels. By default the border width is set to zero which means that the border will not appear.

children.name: border.color
children.description: The color of the border. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: border
children.description: The border of the QR code.

children.name: background
children.description: The background color of the QR code. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.
